sen.j: 今出川実興（いまでがわ さねおき、享保元年（1716年）‐享保15年11月5日 (旧暦)（1730年12月14日））は、江戸時代中期の廷臣。
sen.e: Saneoki Imadegawa (1716-1730) was a retainer of the Imperial Court during the middle of the Edo period.
Saneoki Imadegawa (1716 - December 14, 1730) was a retainer of the Imperial Court during the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: ◆「12月14日」が抜けていたので、追記しました。
sen.e: Saneoki Imadegawa (1716 - December 14, 1730) was a retainer of the Imperial Court during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 中御門天皇時代の廷臣だが、早世した。
sen.e: He served as a retainer of the Imperial Court during the time of Emperor Nakamikado, however, he died early.
He served as a retainer of the Imperial Court during the time of Emperor Nakamikado, however, he died early.
He served as a retainer of the Imperial Court during the time of Emperor Nakamikado, however, he died early.

sen.j: 官位も従五位上止まりである。
sen.e: The highest official rank bestowed upon him was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
The highest official rank bestowed upon him was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
The highest official rank bestowed upon him was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 父は権大納言今出川公詮。
sen.e: His father was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kinakira IMADEGAWA.
His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Kinakira IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: ◆ウィキに合わせて、原文の「大納言」を「権大納言」に修正して、訳も修正しました。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Kinakira IMADEGAWA.

sen.j: 母は伏見宮邦永親王の王女。
sen.e: His mother was the princess of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.
His mother was the princess of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.
His mother was the princess of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.

sen.j: 今出川家の嫡男だったが、15歳にして早世している。
sen.e: He was the heir of the Imadegawa family, but he died early, at the age of 15.
He was the heir of the Imadegawa family, but he died early, at the age of 15.
He was the heir of the Imadegawa family, but he died early, at the age of 15.

sen.j: 今出川家の跡は内大臣西園寺致季の子今出川誠季が実興の養子として継いだ。
sen.e: Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Munesue SAIONJI's son, succeeded the Imadegawa family as the adopted son of Saneoki.
Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Munesue SAIONJI's son, succeeded the Imadegawa family as the adopted son of Saneoki.
Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Munesue SAIONJI's son, succeeded the Imadegawa family as the adopted son of Saneoki.
